title: Highly Recommend for New Years Eve
content: My mom and I are in cabin 9.  The cabin is horribly out-dated and needs repairs.  Also, the cabin counter and tabletop surfaces were dirty.  I was thankful I brought Lysol wipes and spray.  I am thankful to have a place to stay but feel like we may have made a bad choice.  The beds are comfortable.  There is everything you need in the kitchen: plates, bowls, glasses, silverware, coffee pot, toaster, and microwave.The view of the lake is fantastic but is blocked by the blinds in between the panes of glass that are broken.We’ll be here for a few more days because there is too much to load up and move.  I’m disappointed because I would expect better from a State Park.

title: Cabin reveiw
content: Spending New Years Eve here and we are having a blast! We are a full family with kids (adults, teens and younger) and they have set up numerous things for kids to do; scavenger hunt, movies, archery, prizes, face paint, ice cream social … and much more. They had a schedule of activities thru the day.  There was a kid friendly countdown and also a separate adults only countdown to midnight.  The lodge also has many things in the lounge that are adult only for those that are trying to enjoy an adult night. Rooms and lodge are cozy and clean. Staff has been helpful and very friendly. We feel very welcome. We’ve been looking for a new kid oriented place to spend New Years Eve and we found it! We will definitely be back.  I would recommend Salt Fork to anyone!

title: Excellent Hiking Opportunities
content: Very nicely appointed cabins with big screen TVs and hot tubs included in each cabin, sleeps six with immediate access to the lake right out the back.

title: Very nice park with great facilities.
content: I visited Salt Fork State Park in Lore City with a friend on a day trip from Columbus on a fine summer day.  The main purpose of our outing was to go on a couple of hikes.  First we stopped at the Visitor Center (not open) and picked up a trail map.  We enjoyed the short (1/2 mile) Mosak's Cave Trail where the trail ended at a cave with a waterfall.  Getting to the top of the cave is prohibited due to the danger of falls from cliffs.  Our second hike was the Stone House Loop Trail (about 2 miles).  For the front leg of this hike we took the lake side trail, and had good views of the lake; and on the return leg we took the landside trail which had more rock formations.  Both sections were quite woodsy.  The Stone House was closed, but we still enjoyed walking around the historic building.  The trail is well maintained.  Note that the Stone House also has roadway access.Salt Fork State Park is a nice park with lots of recreational opportunities, though we explored only a part of the hiking trails during our half day visit.

title: A place of natural beauty
content: Be sure to check out everything the park has on-line, as there's plenty to do. Love to come the next chance we get.

title: Overall, not very good for tent camping.
content: It is easy to see why Salt Fork was made into a State Park.  We were particularly impressed with the swimming beaches.  We didn't stay in a cabin but it was tempting to see them tucked away into the trees and close to the lake.

title: Dirty!
content: First, here are the positives:1. Very large state park with many hiking trails (mostly 2 miles and under), a museum (Stone House), horse camping, and other attractions.2. The reservoir is also large, and I think fishers and boaters would love it.3. Campsite bathrooms are clean to the extent that the toilets and sinks are kept clean, although there were many old cobwebs above eye level (not uncommon in state parks I've visited). 4. The park is very popular with RV-ers, so it's probably also good for them.. 5. The campground is fairly quiet.6. We saw the camp hosts several times during our stay, which made me feel they were making an effort to look after things.7. We also walked through the Lodge, and it looked inviting.8. Staff members we encountered were friendly and courteous.Having said all this, it is unlikely we will return. We were in site A24, which looked spacious and wooded on the ReserveOhio website. It wasn't. We were in full sun beginning about 10 am, and there was barely any room to pitch our tents. It had a nice long parking spot, and when we looked at other sites, it was clear most of them were similar. Each had a long tarmac spot for an RV or trailer on, with little room to pitch tents. We've stayed at several other Ohio state parks, as well as a few in other states, and they've had plenty of grass on which to put our tent, with room to spare. Expecting Salt Fork to be the same, we'd  invited our daughter and her partner to bring their tent to camp with us. Unfortunately, the set-up at our site meant both our tents were literally inches (or in our case, about 1") from the road. Definitely not ideal. Not even close to ideal. Curious, we drove through most the loops, and in the whole campground saw maybe 5-6 sites that were suitable for tents. There were a few at the end of our Loop (A) and 3 across from the G Loop (designated tent only T01, T02, and T03). In summary, if you camp with an RV or camper, or you are a boater, you will probably like Salt Fork State Campground. If you camp in a tent, not so much.

title: Not following there own Covid safety measures
content: Cabins are horribly dirty. Oven kept stopping. Dead bugs on the ceiling in the kitchen! Windows have clearly never been cleaned.

title: I highly recommend!
content: They state that they have measures in place do to covid. However they don’t have any pool police or anyone monitoring the pool area. There were well over 50 people swimming although the sign stated the capacity was 25 more then half the people weren’t wearing bracelets they provide. The hot tub was a cesspool again patroons not following the measures put in place and no one monitoring. Very disappointed.

title: Great pandemic getaway
content: My wife, two daughters, and I recently returned from our second stay in a chalet cabin. Everything was great! The cabin was nice and clean, the girls loved the bunk beds, and we all thought the hot tub was fantastic. The employees at Salt Fork State Park went above and beyond - both during our stay and working with us in advance to book our trip. In fact, their amazing customer service was a big part of the reason we returned - and we will definitely be back for yet another visit.

title: Large State Park With A Variety of Attractions
content: My husband and I were there in October 2020 and we had a great weekend. We stayed in a king room in the lodge and were pleasantly surprised by how roomy it was. It also came with a fridge and a microwave, so we brought our own breakfast food so we didn't have to deal with masks/restaurants going out for breakfast. We also were surprised by the bar at the lodge; we didn't expect to feel safe enough to eat there, but the tables were spaced far apart, the waitresses wore masks, and the high cathedral ceiling helped it not feel closed in. Plus the waitresses and the food were really great. We ate there Fri and Sat night. There were nice hiking trails at the park too and a nice disc golf course nearby, and we picked up lunch to go at a restaurant in nearby Byesville, Marlene's Rsetaurant & Bar -- people weren't masking  there but got food to go for lunch and I got some of the best pancakes I've ever had, world class. All in all, a great weekend.

title: Beautiful color of the trees in the fall
content: We've visited Salt Fork State Park at least twice, most recently in the late fall in November 2020.Salt Fork is in a very rural part of Ohio, but it is easy to access as it is only about 5-10 minutes from I-77. The park itself is enormous, something like 20,000 acres (or about 30 square miles) and it feels like it. The heart of the park is a 3,000 acre lake that meanders everywhere, so there are ample good views of it.They have a little bit of everything here. There is a lodge with pool and (during non-pandemic times) a restaurant. There is camping. And a golf course. And horse trails. And a nature center. And fishing. You get the idea . . . We came here on a fine fall afternoon and mostly enjoyed the views. There are trails all over for both hikers and horseback riders.Towards the north end of the park (which is more or less the farthest point from the entrance) there is a ravine that leads to a vary large (maybe 75 foot tall) cave. The trail is short but pretty rough. It makes a nice view, but as tempting as it may look, don't try to climb above the cave as someone died doing so just a few years ago.We did have one quibble with the park, which was the lack of a good map and signage. We were able to find what we wanted, but given the abundance of options we would have liked a better idea of what hikes there were, their length, what you could see, etc.I stayed at the lodge on a business retreat many years ago. It is pretty much as it was in the 1990s and appears to be undergoing some upgrades.This is a nice park with lots of options for a weekend trip, although I suspect that many stay longer.

title: 꼭 가보세요!
content: 12 월 19 일 케임브리지와 케임브리지 대학교를 방문했습니다. 아름다운 도시, 멋진 대학, 그리고 King 's College Chapell은 훌륭합니다. 나는 높은 문화와 교육의 느낌에 놀랄 것이라고 기대하지 않았으며, 또한 대학 도시에서 왔습니다. 그러나 케임브리지 대학교는 장소 그 자체보다 더 많은 경험입니다. 유감스럽게도 Cambridge University Library를 방문 할 수 없습니다. 나는 또한 대학 도서관에서 일하기 때문에 경험은 독특했을 것입니다.

title: 하루 날잡아서 갔다오기 정말 좋네요
content: 영국에 머무는 중 가장 좋았던 캠브리지! 특히 비오는 날의 캠브리지는 풍경도, 날씨도, 커피도 가장 영국스러웠어요. 캠브리지는 꼭 가보세요!

title: 캠브리지 대학
content: 런던하고는 날씨도 그리고 분위기도 다릅니다. 정말 좋네요. 고풍스런 대학교와 여유로운 분위기 영국의 지성이 달리 높은게 아니네요. 공부가 절로 될듯

title: 캠퍼스 내 보트 타기
content: 저는 주요 대학 건물을 보기 위해king's parade에서 길 따라 한바퀴를 돌아서 모두 구경했어요.별다른 동선은 없으니 각자의 스타일대로 돌아서 보면 될 것 같아요.

title: 역사와 건축
content: 캠브리지 대학교는 런던에서 50 마일 떨어진 케임브리지에있는 대학 연구 대학입니다. 1209 년에 설립되었습니다.캠브리지는 두 번째로 오래된 대학입니다 (이 영어권 세계에서).캠퍼스는 거대하고 동문은 가이드 워킹 투어와 보트 투어를 조직합니다.음식 마구간은 많고 음식 맛있습니다.

title: 멋진 건물
content: 유서 깊은 건물과 대학을 돌아 다니는 것이 환상적입니다. 건축 스타일의 범위는 인상적이며 다양한 박물관에 포함 된 역사는 실망스럽지 않습니다. 공부하고 살기 좋은 곳입니다.

title: 캠브리지 대학교의 멋진 가이드 투어
content: 케임브리지 대학교의 건축물, 안마당 및 부지는 다른 것입니다. 각기 다른 방식으로 멋진 건물이 있습니다.

title: 케임브리지 대학 주변의 훌륭한 개인 여행
content: 캠브리지 대학교를 방문하기 위해 가이드 여행에 갔다. 투어 가이드에는 역사, 흥미로운 이벤트 및 유명한 대학교 학생들이 있습니다. 건물, 안뜰 및 River Cam은 lovely했습니다. 우리는했다. 또는 폭우로 인해 수위가 높아 강 캠에서 펀트를 할 수 있습니다. 방문하고보아야합니다.

title: 매우 훌륭한 Kinga Collage
content: 즐겁고 유익한 경험이나 개인 여행을 찾았습니다. Dick Matthews 우리 가이드는 우리에게 놀랍게도 Kings 대학을 포함하는 정통하고 잘 조직 된 여행을 줬다. 이 역사적인 도시에 대해 더 알고 싶은 캠브리지 방문객에게 적극 권장합니다.

title: 케임브리지는 놀랍습니다!
content: 아름답게 위치한 대학, 기념비, 넓은 정원 및 오랜 역사를 자랑하는 웅장한 건물입니다. 한번 볼 가치가 있습니다.

title: Absolutely mezzmerized by the quantity of different butterflies
content: we held our daughter's wedding at the Butterfly conservatory in early September. They were absolutely fantastic and helping us to organize both the ceremony in the greenhouse, and the dinner afterwards in their cafeteria. It was transformed into a beautiful setting for the dinner and we had plenty of room for dancing after the tables were cleared. I would highly recommend this as an alternative wedding venue for anyone!

title: Great space for a visit
content: The conservatory has a prepurchase off site ticket sales programe, however we just went as walk ins at 11 m , no problemI suggest you buy the inexpensive butterfly guide on front counter  about $1.25. Be prepared for an amazing visit from the butterflies. There are 2 other rooms of artifacts and live spiders :). Onsite are veery clean washrooms and a dining restauraunt , very reasonabley priced

title: Isn’t nature beautiful?
content: Great cafe and outdoor area as well. Worth the time to see if there is a school visit scheduled as you plan. Wear bright colours or floral patterns as some butterflies landed on people or came closer to check you out.It is hot and humid so dress accordingly. Gift shop worth a visit also.

title: Loved IT!!
content: A lovely place to spend an afternoon. Been visiting for over 20 years with my son. A special memory every time. If you’re lucky enough to go on a quieter day, the environment is so lovely you could spend several hours just watching the butterflies and birds in the solarium.  We’re lucky to have such a gem here in this area!

title: Definitely worth it if in the area
content: This was the second time we have been to the butterfly conservatory.  The first time was in 2005 when my children were little.  It was still as enjoyable in 2022 as it was in 2005.

title: A wonderful experience for everyone!
content: Really enjoyed our visit. It wasn’t too crowded, which helped.  There are two rooms full of live insects, amphibians, scorpions, etc, in cases……these are very well done, with lots of good info.  Also some dead creatures in cases.  Some really amazing creatures on display!  Then the huge butterfly and bird space.   A great variety of butterflies, birds, even some fish and we saw a turtle in the water. Staff was friendly.  It was not too hot, probably around 80 degrees. Beautiful plants and water features, and you can walk behind a waterfall. Our kids loved getting within inches of a very relaxed quail who was walking around. Lots of benches to sit and enjoy the serenity. There is a cafe, which we did not use. Entrance is fairly expensive……$8 for kids and $20 for adults. We were there for 90 minutes. All in all, a very enjoyable time for kids and adults.

title: Borboletário
content: What a wonderful experience! Many beautiful butterflies flying around in and open concept. A tropical garden with a pond and waterfall. Butterflies all over flying near you and sometimes they will rest on your clothes. Fun for children!

title: Visit the Tropics!
content: Adorei visitar!Muitas espécies, ambiente agradável e a parte do borboleta achei maravilhosa.Uma réplica de floresta, cheia de espécies de borboletas, soltas, que voam entre os visitantes.Que experiência maravilhosa!

title: Good visit
content: We walked into the tropics surrounded by birds snd butterflies. It was magical! So much to see and learn and photograph. Our cameras needed to acclimatize before the lenses would stop fogging up. The staff was exceptional with a shout out to Nicole for her professionalism in a variety of circumstances. Don’t leave without visiting the hissing cockroach display at the front desk! Two hours well spent, went by too quickly!

title: Love this place, visit yearly.
content: Good visit during week, not many people. Best to go slow and watch butterflies and birds as they move. Great photos.Not that big but take your time we were there about 90 minutes. Staff very friendly and helpful, if u have kids ask staff questions, one brought out Madagascar cockroach. Good displays in other rooms worth looking at.VERY WARM so dress appropriately, there is a self serve coat room.Used a macro lens mostly if photography your interest.  No tripods allowed.

title: Absolutely mezzmerized by the quantity of different butterflies
content: We've been going here for a few years now with our small kids. Beautiful place, great way to kill some time with kiddos, very affordable.

title: Great space for a visit
content: The conservatory has a prepurchase off site ticket sales programe, however we just went as walk ins at 11 m , no problemI suggest you buy the inexpensive butterfly guide on front counter  about $1.25. Be prepared for an amazing visit from the butterflies. There are 2 other rooms of artifacts and live spiders :). Onsite are veery clean washrooms and a dining restauraunt , very reasonabley priced

Good displays in other rooms worth looking at.VERY WARM so dress appropriately, there is a self serve coat room.Used a macro lens mostly if photography your interest.  No tripods allowed.

title: Anniversary day activity
content: We've been going here for a few years now with our small kids. Beautiful place, great way to kill some time with kiddos, very affordable.

title: Are we in Costa Rica?
content: I love butterflies and seeing them reminds me of my late Mother. My husband took me here on our anniversary and we absolutely loved it! Beautiful tropical feeling and amazing butterflies landed on me! Very friendly staff and COVID precautions are appreciated! Highly recommended!

title: Butterfly Conservatory
content: Wow! Amazing place! We were warmly greeted by a front desk employee for our 2pm time slot. The facility promotes safe distance with sanitizing stations throughout. We were given the choice to visit the butterflies or insects first. Two rooms filled with living crickets, roaches, spiders, bees, frogs, etc. Both educational and entertaining. The butterflies, birds and plants were lovely. We felt transported to Costa Rica. Staff are friendly and approachable ready to educate and answer questions. Sitting on benches watching the butterflies flutter around was so peaceful. Some tickled us when they landed on our arms and head. We purchased wonderful souvenirs from the gift shop. Will try the cafe next time. Impressive property!

title: Beautiful
content: Entering into the garden was as if you were in a movie, a magical and tropical paradise...you hear water running birds chirping and because it was winter, you had summer vibes👌

title: Hot, humid and majestic
content: Wow! what a wonderful place . I have been approximately 8 times. My father and I used to love to go and just enjoy all the plants and wonderful butterflies. Great Memories ! Staff are very knowledgable. Such a great place to take kids to learn about nature. I highly recommend

title: A Day Trip
content: There are hundreds of butterflies fluttering about you (or landing on you), exotic birds at your feet and cool exhibits to learn about all the creatures. The passion from the staff offering information, tours and helping you interact with the creatures is a definite plus. We learned so much and were amazed by the learning centres where you could see butterflies emerging from their cocoons or enjoying a tray of sweet treats. The critters were all well cared for and enjoying a beautiful habitat. We spent about an hour looking around and then we visited the lovely gift shop (something for everyone) and enjoyed a light lunch at the spacious cafe. Pleasantly surprised by the experience.

title: An out of the way Gem!
content: Filled with tropical plants with wheel chair accessibility around waterfalls and rock gardens. We viewed over a few dozen different butterflies fluttering around us within the hour. There’s also a cafe and gift shops available.

title: Monarch tagging
content: This has become a standard for our daughter & grandchildren on Family Day.  The kids (and adults apparently) love watching the butterflies and birds flitter about among the plants & trees.  Take your camera and have your kids wear something with a brightly coloured flower and there is a good chance a butterfly will land.  There are lots of other things (insects / bugs etc) to see also and there is a small cafe there to satisfy most people.

title: Great place to visit -especially in winter
content: I love butterflies and to be able to tag a butterfly before it migrates to Mexico was amazing. We were also able to attend a very informative info session! Can't wait to go back in December for the Flight of white.

title: September Wedding
content: While it’s small, it’s a really interesting place to visit with a huge number of butterflies. They land on you which is quite cool. The facility is beautiful with its water and tropical plants and a warm retreat in the dead of winter.

title: Fiddler On The Roof
content: A Few Good Men was amazing right from the acting, to the set design, to the scene changes.   Drayton theatre never disappoints.

title: Wonderful!
content: Great show. Wonderful voices and a storyline which is applicable today. Enjoyed by entire family including A 9 and 11 year Olds.

title: A fantastic show and the actors were superb even Santa Claus !!!
content: Because of timing and other commitments, 3 of us went to a Matinee not expecting the same experience as the glitz of an evening performance. We were very happily surprised and thrilled with the performance, the singing, the amazing dancing, and the props. We got teary-eyed in the same places, and were sad when the show was over.  Kudos to those actors who can give such performances time-after-time and whether for a matinee or not. It was special.It was extra nice to come out into the dark to see the Christmas decorating of the Gaslight District and to enjoy a wonderful dinner at the Foundry Tavern. With everything being so close together, it made for a very fun time for us and we'd do it again in a heartbeat.

title: Fantastic local talent
content: The show was absolutely fantastic and Alex is performing superbly as the days go on!!Merry Christmas to all

title: Spectacular Show....Fiddler
content: We frequent the Hamilton theatre as well the St Jacobs playhouse often. We try to see almost every show produced. The acting, producing, stage props, music are fantastic! We are always so elated when we leave the shows! Always anxiously awaiting for the next show! No need to go to those high priced Toronto shows! Support local & be wowed!

title: Super good experience!!!
content: Went to Fiddler. A wonderful performance. Sets were grand. Players were great especially Alex. Teriffic venue.Will be getting Jersey Boys tickets.

title: Fantastic entertainment!
content: Another fantastic Drayton show!!!Captivating from start to finish!!! The music, the singing, the acting, the dancing: everything just superb!!!Thank you Drayton entertainment!!!!

title: Fantastic, like all the shows we see at Drayton.
content: We have enjoyed every Drayton performance we have attended. The talent is amazing! We have not been to all the venues, but all the ones we have are exceptional.

title: Drayton Entertainment's Kinky Boots... The Most Beautiful Musical in the world!
content: Another terrific performance!  The cast was wonderful. Evita and Che gave great performances.  The singing was phenomenal.  Saw this in Toronto in the 80s so the story never grows old.

title: WONDERFUL experience!
content: Just when I thought David Connolly couldn’t surprise or delight me more with his Incomparable brilliance as Director & Choreographer, he proved me wrong with Kinky Boots!! I was blessed to have seen it at the Hamilton Family Theatre on opening night and closing matinee.  I now understand why people have seen it multiple times!  Because of this production, this has become my all-time favourite musical!   From the moment the curtain rose, I was captivated and hooked to the very last musical note and last surprise red streamer falling on me!  I would give this production Endless Stars because it was WOW and had something for everyone. It was a smorgasbord for the senses from the superb and talented cast and crew, to the gorgeous costumes, makeup on Jos and the Angels, set designs, and unforgettable musical score which I cannot stop listening to! Everyone was brilliant in it, but for me, Jos N. Banks and Sayer Roberts’ chemistry and poignant acting did it for me!  They were THE PERFECT Lola/Simon and Charlie. Jos had a powerful and "larger than life" stage presence which took my breath away!  I LOVED all the dance numbers especially with the Angels which were insanely fast-paced, flawlessly executed, and in all those fabulous heels, no less!!!  Thank you, Angels, for inspiring me to improve my daily exercise routine; I aim to be as fit as you and to achieve those killer legs!  :o) I LOVED seeing many of my favourite Drayton regulars like Jackie, Blythe, AJ, George, Trayvon, Alyssa, Cassel, Stephanie, and Andrew take on new roles and showcasing the endless talents they have as well as being introduced to new actors. This production felt like attending a long-awaited family reunion and I am super thankful I was there for it! Thank YOU, Alex, David, Gary Good, Drayton Entertainment staff and volunteers for always welcoming me with a smile and for sharing and spreading Love, Joy, Laughter, Heart, Powerful and Impactful messages, one play, one musical, at a time!  Keep doing what you are doing because… You are “The most beautiful thing in the world!!”   If you haven’t seen a Drayton show before, what are you waiting for?  You will have THE time of your life and will come back again and again. Guaranteed.

title: Fiddler On The Roof
content: Wonderful! We went to see Kinky Boots and it was amazing. The actors, music, production and theatre were all great. Highly recommend it!

title: Wonderful!
content: Great show. Wonderful voices and a storyline which is applicable today. Enjoyed by entire family including A 9 and 11 year Olds.

title: A fantastic show and the actors were superb even Santa Claus !!!
content: Because of timing and other commitments, 3 of us went to a Matinee not expecting the same experience as the glitz of an evening performance. We were very happily surprised and thrilled with the performance, the singing, the amazing dancing, and the props. We got teary-eyed in the same places, and were sad when the show was over.  Kudos to those actors who can give such performances time-after-time and whether for a matinee or not. It was special.It was extra nice to come out into the dark to see the Christmas decorating of the Gaslight District and to enjoy a wonderful dinner at the Foundry Tavern. With everything being so close together, it made for a very fun time for us and we'd do it again in a heartbeat.

title: Fantastic local talent
content: The show was absolutely fantastic and Alex is performing superbly as the days go on!!Merry Christmas to all

title: Spectacular Show....Fiddler
content: We frequent the Hamilton theatre as well the St Jacobs playhouse often. We try to see almost every show produced. The acting, producing, stage props, music are fantastic! We are always so elated when we leave the shows! Always anxiously awaiting for the next show! No need to go to those high priced Toronto shows! Support local & be wowed!

title: Super good experience!!!
content: Went to Fiddler. A wonderful performance. Sets were grand. Players were great especially Alex. Teriffic venue.Will be getting Jersey Boys tickets.

title: Fantastic entertainment!
content: Another fantastic Drayton show!!!Captivating from start to finish!!! The music, the singing, the acting, the dancing: everything just superb!!!Thank you Drayton entertainment!!!!

title: Fantastic, like all the shows we see at Drayton.
content: We have enjoyed every Drayton performance we have attended. The talent is amazing! We have not been to all the venues, but all the ones we have are exceptional.

title: Drayton Entertainment's Kinky Boots... The Most Beautiful Musical in the world!
content: Another terrific performance!  The cast was wonderful. Evita and Che gave great performances.  The singing was phenomenal.  Saw this in Toronto in the 80s so the story never grows old.

title: WONDERFUL experience!
content: Just when I thought David Connolly couldn’t surprise or delight me more with his Incomparable brilliance as Director & Choreographer, he proved me wrong with Kinky Boots!! I was blessed to have seen it at the Hamilton Family Theatre on opening night and closing matinee.  I now understand why people have seen it multiple times!  Because of this production, this has become my all-time favourite musical!   From the moment the curtain rose, I was captivated and hooked to the very last musical note and last surprise red streamer falling on me!  I would give this production Endless Stars because it was WOW and had something for everyone. It was a smorgasbord for the senses from the superb and talented cast and crew, to the gorgeous costumes, makeup on Jos and the Angels, set designs, and unforgettable musical score which I cannot stop listening to! Everyone was brilliant in it, but for me, Jos N. Banks and Sayer Roberts’ chemistry and poignant acting did it for me!  They were THE PERFECT Lola/Simon and Charlie. Jos had a powerful and "larger than life" stage presence which took my breath away!  I LOVED all the dance numbers especially with the Angels which were insanely fast-paced, flawlessly executed, and in all those fabulous heels, no less!!!  Thank you, Angels, for inspiring me to improve my daily exercise routine; I aim to be as fit as you and to achieve those killer legs!  :o) I LOVED seeing many of my favourite Drayton regulars like Jackie, Blythe, AJ, George, Trayvon, Alyssa, Cassel, Stephanie, and Andrew take on new roles and showcasing the endless talents they have as well as being introduced to new actors. This production felt like attending a long-awaited family reunion and I am super thankful I was there for it! Thank YOU, Alex, David, Gary Good, Drayton Entertainment staff and volunteers for always welcoming me with a smile and for sharing and spreading Love, Joy, Laughter, Heart, Powerful and Impactful messages, one play, one musical, at a time!  Keep doing what you are doing because… You are “The most beautiful thing in the world!!”   If you haven’t seen a Drayton show before, what are you waiting for?  You will have THE time of your life and will come back again and again. Guaranteed.

title: Bravo! Well done!
content: Wonderful! We went to see Kinky Boots and it was amazing. The actors, music, production and theatre were all great. Highly recommend it!

title: Our favourite Drayton Theatre - Outstanding
content: As always, Drayton did not disappoint. Kinky Boots was cast well and the music was excellent. It was fun but he ad a serious message.

title: FANTASTIC!  Don’t miss Kinky Boots
content: Our favourite Drayton theatre. Seats are large and comfie, and lots of handicap seating. Shows are excellent generally. I've run out of superlatives. We make it to a few performances every year. The musicals in particular are just outstanding. Highly recommended. Today we attended Kinky Boots, just outstanding (which I've come to expect from Drayton). Great performance by a company who just clicked. Music by Cyndi Lauper, wow. The band was as awesome as was everyone else. Superlative.

title: OUTSTANDING ....don't miss Kinky Boots
content: Went to see Kinky Boots for the second time with Drayton Theatre!  The actors, music and costumes were fantastic!

title: For a good time it’s a MUST see
content: This place has amazing live theatre.  Just went to see Kinky Boots and it was outstanding!!!  I would highly recommend looking into Drayton Theatre Entertainment.Anything they do is of the highest caliber.  Hamilton Family Theatre is just that. They offer great shows in all age ranges.

title: Show productions
content: A very good quality performance. I was not disappointed. I dragged my Dad (who hates everything) and even he said it was one of the BEST shows he’s ever seen. Success!

title: Don't hesitate, Kinky Boots is AWESOME !
content: We are so amazingly lucky to have dunfeild productions in good ole Cambridge!!! I have booked almost every show produced & have never been disappointed!! Fantastic talent! Every night has had me glowing for days after! Can't wait for my next show!!!

title: Very Enjoyable
content: We were not sure about Kinky Boots, but we bought tickets because every musical we have attended in the past was well worth the price of admission.. Kinky Boots was no exception! As a mater of fact KB was one of the best acted, best performed, most talented production we have enjoyed. The story was revealing and powerful. The on-stage talent was world class! We could praise all the performers equally but just to pick a few, Jos Banks was inspirational, Sayer Roberts was exceptional and Aj Bridel was an absolute delight. Bravo !

title: Excellent! A Few Good Men - A Must See!!!
content: Excellent live entertainment right in our own neighbour. Everyone is friendly. I will be going again.  :)

title: Awesome time at Hamilton theatre
content: A Few Good Men was a superb show with excellent acting, sets etc... nothing could have been better. I thoroughly enjoyed it! I am an avid theatre goer in England, Toronto, Drayton Theatre's and more.  I would highly recommend it.

title: Gravel - Larger tire recommended for road cyclists
content: This is great trail to bicycle by yourself or with friends. It is a trail that parallels the beautiful Grand River. Much of the trail is in the shade which is great on a hot day. Unless you are a seasoned bicycler you may find the distance from Cambridge to Paris and then back again too much for one day. You may wish to divide this into two trails – do Cambridge to Glen Morris one day and Glen Morris to Paris on another day. Now If you prefer to go upstream (or uphill) first and then return downstream (or downhill), bike from Paris to Glen Morris and then back to Paris. Or bike from Glen Morris to Cambridge (which is my favourite) to a Tim Horton’s near the trail located on the outskirts of Cambridge on Hwy 24. Leave the trail at the Cambridge Treatment Plant to get to Timmy’s. Have a drink and snack and then bike back to Glen Morris. In Glen Morris there is a parking lot along the trail at the end of Forbes Street.

title: Nice shaded busy trail
content: Road cyclists should be mindful of gravel. We started from Cambridge where the gravel was smoother but it became more close to Paris. At Paris, we stopped at the lookout spot by the dam which was breathtaking  and had a quick tour in the small and cozy town of Paris.

title: Imposing stone ruins of the German Woolen Mill are a most worthwhile hike from Glen Morris car park up river along the rail trai
content: Took the trail one way from Paris trail head walking towards Cambridge trail head (next to Petro gas station).Paris trail head starts at 58.2 km - finishing in Cambridge trail head at 77 km.The trail is 1/3 part of the larger trail starting from Hamilton - Brantford - Cambridge.Trail is very good and the path is well maintained - there are multiple stop points if required, trail remains busy during the day as there are people walking small sections or biking longer stretches.Well shaded and great place to go for a walk/stroll in small sections or just take the whole day and make a nice day/afternoon out of it.Parking areas (both sides) are small and it is a popular trail - so you want to either get here early or you might have to wait for a while.Good photo stop points along the way include - Glen Murray lookout point, Old Abandoned mill (private property) and a bench lookout view closer to Cambridge end..Total trail is of 18.8km and takes roughly 5 hrs to walk if you take breaks.Nice trail and definitely worth walking when you want a nice relaxed walk and great way to exercise and get out.

title: Paris Trailhead
content: The Old German Woolen Mill ruin near Glen Morris along the Cambridge to Paris rail trail is an unexpected encounter with history. It’s cut stone walls and raceway arches and overall imposing height are testimony to the skills of the stone masons who built it. Access is now signed as no trespassing, although it can be viewed from the rail trail or off a roadway in front of the ruins.

title: Great Bike Trail
content: This is a easy trail with great views of the river and the forest. I've met many families with young children, what a great introduction for the youngsters. Unfortunately many irresponsible owners of dogs have left it dirty and feces covered in the Paris area. One mess was within 20 feet of the parking lot garbage barrel. Unsanitary and a health risk to responsible pet owners and those children who use the trail.A great walk spoiled for me and my dog!

title: Great hike or bike trail
content: We biked the trail, which was beauitful as well as challenging when going round trip. Before heading back to Cambridge we stopped in Paris for some lunch. It was a great day!

title: Pretty, but not real quiet in some spots
content: Excellent trail for hiking or biking with stops in towns along the way or on the trail for picturesque pic nice. Lots of viewing of the river which is accessible for tubing

title: Walk to Paris, or bike part of the trail - its a great place to be!
content: This trail parallels the Grand River, which is nice, but it runs close to busy highways in many areas.  Better for a bike ride than for a quiet hike in the woods.

title: Good Trail
content: We walked from my house in Cambridge and stayed at the hotel in Paris - the historic one - it was fab. Had dinner in the pub across the street, but have dined at Stillwaters also - both were great. :) Walked home the next day, was a crazy silly idea to walk but reminiscent of the Camino Trail in Spain. :) lots of other paddlers putting in and taking out, walkers with kids and runners and bikers along the trail. Some there for a longer haul, some for an hour or two.

title: Great for the whole family
content: A good trail, but not exceptional. We had to get off our tandem several times because of soft gravel a d mud. Also, some areas of the trail were very narrow. We did, however, enjoy going into Paris and completing the ride back to Cambridge. One food thing is that the trail is mostly flat.

title: Easy, beautiful trail
content: This trail supports both cycling and walking.  I have a road bike and have no difficulty on this trail.   We enjoy making a day of it.  We leave from Cambridge and go to Paris for something to eat and drink and return on the trail.   Lots of opportunities to get off the trail and enjoy the river that winds along the trail.  Great way to get your exercise in a beautiful environment.  Good parking for your car in Cambridge beside the trail.

title: Absolutely Beautiful
content: Great for biking.  Not paved but very fine gravel so safe for everyone.  If in Paris you can also rent a tube or kayak to float down the river, which also looks very low key.

title: Wonderful safe biking
content: This scenic trail is flat, well maintained and offers multiple access points.  It runs adjacent to the historic Grand River with beautiful vistas and a river lookout along the way.  When you get to Paris, take advantage of some ice cream, cozy pubs/restaurants or a quaint downtown shopping district.

title: Bike or walk
content: Excellent chance to bike with no cars. Kilometers of straight, easy pathway. Really popular with walkers so if you want to go on a Sunday go early or it's too crowded

title: Lovely Trail
content: Great trail used by many you never have to encounter trafic which is a bonus for famalies.  A long walk though.

title: The view of the river is amazing
content: Just did the 20km walk a couple of days ago.  Nice, easy walking trail (flat, excellent condition).  Enjoyed the Paris to Glen Morris section the most, make sure you take time to visit the lookout point. We googled the Glen Morris restaurant before we left and thought it opened at 9:00.  We arrived at 10:30 and found out that it doesn’t open until 11:00.  Disappointing when we were looking forward to a break and a bathroom.  Visited the library to use the facilities, grabbed a granola bar out of our pack and continued on.  Just a heads up for other morning walkers Very enjoyable though.

title: Easy Stroll
content: Wonderful trail for all ages.  Is great for biking too.  Works great this time of year when all the other trails are still wet and muddy .

title: Beautiful and Peaceful
content: Nice flat trail, great for walking or biking. The trail can get busy at times but it’s nice and wide so we never had to worry about getting in the way of bikers or other hikers.

title: Love this walk
content: Its a fantastic way to spend a few hours away from the hustle and bustle of regular life.  Great for a weekend hike!

title: Great bike trail
content: Little piece of heaven.  Quiet, well kept and safe.  Close to town yet you feel like you in the country with the woods and Grand river.

title: amazing trail
content: Fantastic trail. Old railway route. Mainly flat. At times very busy. Great for hiking or biking or slow stroll. If it is quiet you are sure to spot deer along your way.

title: Great for everyone, even in winter
content: i love this trail, usually make it a saturday or sunday morning activity before brunch time. dog friendly and easy walking trail

title: great trail to walk,bike or run
content: Nice easy trail, lots of friendly folks. Easy for new hikers and beautiful enough for seasoned walkers/hikers/runners/cyclist. A wee bit stinky as you pass by the Cambridge water treatment plant but despite that, the trail is a good one.

title: Great trails
content: Be sure to take your camera, great trail, well kept, Grand River runs along. take your own water and snack

title: Nice trail
content: Great trail to go with family or by your self. Good walking, or riding your bike. Lots of wild life to be seen. Very clean all year round. Close to the Grand River and you even have a chance to go fishing. And if your lucky you could even see the Bold Eagles that are known to nest around the Grand River.

title: Great Sunday Ride
content: Very nice biking or hiking trail. Mostly flat with packed gravel or sand surface. Most of the trail is through the forest or tall bushes along Grand River shores. Nice views of the river in many spots.

title: Beautiful Ride
content: Beautiful scenic trail along the Grand River. Nice flat easy ride, with washrooms mid point. Just watch out for the Queen Snakes!

title: Nice trail for a beginner.  Unlike other reviews, I did not find it busy
content: This is a great trail alongside of the grand river that has amazing views and a great trail with lots of room for walkers and Bike riders

title: awesome trail. Easy ride
content: I did not find this trail busy ( I went on a Saturday).  There was a little litter, but not near what I have seen elsewhere.  This was my first ride off pavement.  It is a nice ride.  I rode alone and found everyone on the trail friendly. Benches along the way and a bathroom 1/2 way.  I will definitely do this ride again.  Leave early enough so you have time to spend in Paris.  It is a great little town with lots of interesting shops and restaurants.

title: Cambridge to Glen Morris to Paris Rail Trail
content: Great trail for beginners or seasoned riders or walking. The trail is mainly shade covered so not too hot in summer. Very flat and the surface is hard packed.

title: Great date idea/experience!
content: We had a great time exploring different flavours and making our own Gin, Max who was our host made the experience 100x better. Definitely will be going back.

title: Fun Festive Evening
content: We booked this spontaneously on the day and didn't really know what to expect, but we enjoyed every minute! We were given interesting facts and made to feel comfortable in a relaxed atmosphere and there was lots of equipment to use which was all laid out for us. We were guided through the making and tasting of the drinks and could also hang around afterwards to chat and have more drinks if we wanted. A really fun date and would definitely recommend!

title: Brilliant London Pop up experience!!
content: We did the Festive cocktail mixing class. It was good fun and Max was a great host with a little Christmas quiz thrown in. We met some lovely people and had a great time.If you are expecting loads of gin to drink then this is not the class to take. You get to mix 3 cocktails with 3 different Cambridge gins - 3 single size gin shots.There is a shop though if you want to buy some of your own

title: Tipsy Fun!
content: What another great experience from Cambridge Gin Distillery!! A group of us had already visited whilst in Cambridge a couple of years back and experienced the ‘Mix it’ class. When the London pop up ‘Make it’ class was advertised we didn’t hesitate in booking. The class was welcoming, incredibly informative and great fun. We sampled and created our own Gin with an option for it to be made there and then and purchased. We were also able to purchase the Christmas edition bottle (delicious) amongst others during our visit! A great inexpensive experience topped off with a badge and Gin Christmas cracker (London Dry Gin). From start to finish Matt & Josh were brilliant, well done Cambridge Gin Distillery, Matt & Josh, Thank you!! 🤩 🎄

title: Taste It Experience. 5 Stars ⭐️
content: We went for a gin making masterclass yesterday and had a right, jolly, old time! Max, our tutor, was warm, patient, knowledgeable and good fun. He gave us loads of useful tips for our own gin making experiments at home. Thank you, Max! We were given vouchers as a gift to do this workshop, and would highly recommend this above giving someone stuff for the sake of stuff. It's a really original present and rather wonderful way to spend an hour or so.

title: Gin Tasting Fun,Professional and Informative
content: Fantastic hour long ‘Taste It’ experience. Hosted by a young lad who was excellent - held our interest throughout. I Really interesting potted history of gin, together with tasting of 4 gins. Shame a taster of the £3000 Japanese ‘vapour gin’ wasn’t included!! Highly recommended 👍👏

title: Festive Mix It at Cambridge Gin
content: Small group tasting session (3 of us!). Josh led the tasting very professionally. I learned a lot and the tutored tasting was informative and fun

title: Mix It Class with Matt
content: We went to Cambridge Gin Lab for a Christmas cocktail making class called the Festive Mix It class. The venue was sparkling with light and the signature Cambridge Blue elements were inviting us in. We thought the layout of the lab space in the back room was so creative. It is cosy but feels scientific at the same time. The whole interior of the space is beautiful and it’s located in the middle of Green Street. This is a quaint and cobbled street in the centre of Cambridge.We had a charming host who had everything organised for a fun evening.  We were greeted with a tray of Santa margaritas and made three cocktails including the stunning Christmas pudding martini. We carefully made the cinnamon rim and stirred up the delicious homemade syrup with Cambridge gin. We even had a few fun Christmas quiz questions to answer between making and sipping our drinks. We would highly recommend this experience to do with your favourite people.

title: Gin and Genius, Matthew shows us how to Mix It!
content: We did the Mix It experience. Matt was a great teacher, we learned a lot on the history and taste of gin. The twist on on the drinks was a great experience to figure out what tastes fit better with out taste buds.

title: Great job Matthew!
content: The Mix It Experience at Cambridge Gin Lab was worth every penny. Our host, Matthew, expressed clear passion and knowledge for the history and art of gin making. We felt settled in no time and had a fantastic afternoon of learning, tasting, and laughing.

title: Great date idea/experience!
content: The Mix-it class was a very spontaneous idea, and what an idea it was! Matthew did a fantastic job presenting and hosting us at the lab. We had a blast while hearing interesting stories, trying many different gins, and mixing our cocktails. 10/10. I would recommend it to any friend group. Thanks again, Matthew!

title: Fun Festive Evening
content: We booked this spontaneously on the day and didn't really know what to expect, but we enjoyed every minute! We were given interesting facts and made to feel comfortable in a relaxed atmosphere and there was lots of equipment to use which was all laid out for us. We were guided through the making and tasting of the drinks and could also hang around afterwards to chat and have more drinks if we wanted. A really fun date and would definitely recommend!

title: Great job Matthew!
content: The Mix It Experience at Cambridge Gin Lab was worth every penny. Our host, Matthew, expressed clear passion and knowledge for the history and art of gin making. We felt settled in no time and had a fantastic afternoon of learning, tasting, and laughing.

title: Great way to spend an evening
content: The Mix-it class was a very spontaneous idea, and what an idea it was! Matthew did a fantastic job presenting and hosting us at the lab. We had a blast while hearing interesting stories, trying many different gins, and mixing our cocktails. 10/10. I would recommend it to any friend group. Thanks again, Matthew!

title: Cocktail making
content: We had a fab evening at the Cambridge Gin Lab for our Make it class. Max was a great host and we really enjoyed the relaxed but informative talk on gin and trying out making our own gin’s! Perfect for a uni friends reunion in Cambridge along with some punting and afternoon tea!

title: Perfect introduction to gin
content: We had a cocktail making session with friends. A great and fun thing to do. Would recommend to start an evening out.

title: superb fun
content: This was a great experience through both the tasting and history of gin. Matthew was a superb host, encouraging everyone's engagement and keeping the session going at a steady pace.

title: Must have experience
content: 6 old friends from uni did a "make it" experience. Great fun. learn a lot from Matt, who led the session. Several of us were sufficiently impressed with the gin recipes that we produced, that we purchased the bottle.

title: Outstanding
content: Jenna, who ran the class, was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. She made it fun and interactive. It was definitely an experience.  Will definitely come back to their other classes.

title: Such a great experience!
content: Took the Make your own gin class on a rainy Thursday afternoon. Jenna, our Lab Host was absolutely fantastic- great energy and knowledge and the gin was delicious too! They do cocktails to takeaway after the class, which is fab, definitely made the cold and wet weather much more bearable! A must-visit if you're in Cambridge.

title: Great experience!
content: I was given the Prestige Experience as a birthday present and visited with my husband.  An hour long session where we were taught about the history of and process used to make Cambrige Gin and we also sampled a few!The session was lead by David, who was not only knowledgeable, but was entertaining with it.  I  would thoroughly recommend to any gin lover!

title: Fun evening of Molecular Cocktail making.
content: Took my mum for a birthday present, would highly recommend. Cocktails were delicious and the session was really engaging and relaxed.

title: Excellent Experience
content: Highly recommend the Molecular Cocktail evening. Two hours of mixing cocktails and learning the science behind the drinks and how they taste. The story-telling of the science was excellent, and Helen our host was fabulous. We also got to sample many of the different gins they make, which was very interesting.

title: 대도시의 그런저런 강
content: 강을 따라 건물과 역사를 살펴보세요. 여러 대학에는 강을 따라 캠퍼스가 있으며 유서 깊은 다리도 있습니다. 그것을 보는 가장 좋은 방법은 강을 따라 여행하는 것입니다.

title: 보스턴을 가로지르는 멋진 강
content: 생각보다 크더군요. 보스턴과 캠브리지를 나누며 바다로 흘러갑니다. 보스턴과 캠브리지를 잇는 다리가 많고 강변을 따라 공원과 산책로가 잘 조성돼 있습니다.

title: 찰스 강
content: 보스턴은 항구도시라는 걸 일깨우는 강입니다. 강 때문에 여름엔 좀 더 시원한 거 같습니다. 항구가 주는 낭만이나 운치도 더욱 좋았습니다.

title: 자연스러운 강
content: 케임브릿지와 보스턴 사이를 가르는 강.이 강을 건너면 바로 MIT와 하버드를 만날 수 있게 된다.이 강을 따라서 조성 된 공원에는 조깅을 즐기는 사람들, 휴식을 취하는 사람들이 많이 나와서 도시의 쉼터 역할을 하는 것을 볼 수 있다.

title: 여유와 휴식이 있는 공간
content: 말 그대로 자연스러운 강. 산업화와 도시화의 한켠에서 신음하는 강이 아니라 사람을 포용하고 건물을 안을 수 있는 여유. 그곳에서 요트를 띄우고 달리고 담소하고.

title: 보스턴을 가로지르는 찰스강
content: 이 강은 보스턴 시내와 하버드 대학사이를 흐르는 강으로서 강 주변에 많은 공원과 벤치가 있어 휴식과 대화를 나눌수있는 곳입니다. 몇몇곳은 차량도로가 있어 시끄럽지만 대부분의 곳은 진정한 휴식이 가능한 곳입니다. 특히 하버드대학 건너편쪽에 보스턴 대학이 있는데 이곳도 좋습니다. 다만 주착가 어려워 도로 미터주차기를 잘 찾아 해야겠지요. 아무대나 세우면 경찰이 즉시 옵니다. 귀신 같아요. 누가 신고하는듯...

title: 찰스 강변에서
content: 보스턴을 가로지르는 찰스강변. 높은 건물이 그렇게 많이 않아 고즈넉한 도심을 즐길수 있었어요. 캠브릿지 하얏트에서 머무를때 다리를 건널일이 있었는데 도심이 너무 평화로웠어요.

title: 너무나 아름다운 강이에요.
content: 보스톤과 캠브리지를 가로지는 찰스 강에는 많은 사람들이 달리기를 하는 것을 볼 수 있구요. 가끔 하버드 조정팀이 연습을 하는 것도 볼 수 있습니다. 강변을 거닐면서 보스톤을 바라다보는 풍경도 좋습니다.

title: Boston
content: 하버드 대학교에서 나와서 하버드 스퀘어를 지나, 이 찰스강을 따라 보스턴 시내로 걸어왔어요. 시간은 오래 걸렸지만 정말 구름 한 점 없는 맑은 하늘에 눈부시게 비춰지는 강이 작지만 아름다운 도시 보스턴을 더욱 아름답게 하는 거 같아요. 여유를 가지고 다시 한 번 걸어보고 싶어요.

title: 강을 경험하십시오
content: Harvard campus area를 휘감는 멋있는 River이다 가까이 근처에 멋있는 생활하는 사람들 모습이 좋아 보였다 조경 경기를 하는 campus 학생들 모습이 세계적 우수한 저력을 갖춘 훌륭한 면모를 느낄 수 있었다
